story.title: DocNow Community Chat: Social Media Research

author.name: DocumentingTheNow
author.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by Jamelle Bouie https://t.co/94MSbm0gVsâ€¦

data.text: These tweets were part of Documenting the Now's second Twitter chat on August 11, 2016. The tweets have been curated which means we've attempted to keep conversations and responses to questions grouped together, altering the purely chronological flow of the original stream. We also tried to include replies that did not use the #docnowcommunity hashtag. Please get in touch if you sent a tweet that you would like to have included or removed. info@docnow.io

image.caption: Join us on Thursday, August 11th, 2016 at 2pm EST for a twitter chat on social media research. #docnowcommunity https://t.co/vSbvKBlyr5

quote.text: Join us on Thursday, August 11th, 2016 at 2pm EST for a twitter chat on social media research. #docnowcommunity https://t.co/vSbvKBlyr5

data.text: Introductions

quote.text: Welcome to our Twitter chat about social media research. Please take a moment to introduce yourself #docnowcommunity.

quote.text: hi #docnowcommunity, digital archivist & records manager at a public uni in Ohio. Mostly listening as I compile my #saa16 reimbursement req

attribution.bio: Team Midwest. Digital Archivist/Records Manager at alma mater (A&S '08) @uofcincy. I write about archives & the environment. Avid hiker. All opinions my own.

attribution.name: Ian Milligan

quote.text: Hi I'm Ed Summers, i've done some analysis of Ferguson data with @SociologistRay and @BlackFeministMB & work on docnow #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: Hi, #docnowcommunity. Iâ€™m Dorothea Salo, iSchool instructor, interested in digital (incl web, social media) and A/V preservation.

attribution.bio: A flabby, whiskery, vegetarian creature concerned with iSchools. Beware the claws.
attribution.name: Ondatra iSchoolicus

quote.text: Hi, Iâ€™m Shawn Walker, my research focuses on social media and political participation - especially by social movements. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: Hello all! Nicholas Proferes here, I study users' understandings and beliefs about how social media work #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: Hey #docnowcommunity - I helped organize Documenting #Ferguson https://t.co/Zu5soJUIhE & studied what motivates people to contribute to it

attribution.bio: Information scientist, cyclist, soap maker. Associate University Librarian @WUSTLLibraries. Founding Technical Director @BioDivLibrary.
attribution.name: Chris Freeland

quote.text: I am Desiree Jones-Smith a member of the @documentnow team. I work to manage the project and am excited be a part of #docnowcommunity.

attribution.bio: Don't waste time watching other people live the life you want.
attribution.name: Desiree P. Jones

Q1. What types of research do you do with social media: topics, disciplines, methods?

quote.text: Q1. What types of research do you do with social media: topics, disciplines, methods? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by @jbouie. Tweets by @BergisJules & @edsu
attribution.name: DocumentingTheNow

quote.text: @documentnow I research designing a method for building collections for stories and events esp. without domain knowledge. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: I'm interested in: characteristics of good collections, can we teach a machine to build good collections #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: A1: quite a bit around collecting, analyzing, + thinking about open-source approaches. Work a lot with @ruebot on all this! #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Assistant professor, @waterloohistory. Marshall McLuhan Centenary Fellow at @ischool_TO. Digital history, data mining, textual analysis. Co-editor, @proghist.
attribution.name: Ian Milligan

quote.text: A1. None yet, but based on a small survey we did w researchers, we anticipate future interest https://t.co/nb9RqrJoPN #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: digital libraries and archives
attribution.name: Brian Dietz

quote.text: @documentnow Iâ€™ve worked with @edsu, @BlackFeministMB & @SociologistRay on twitter data from Ferguson & Baltimore Uprising.#docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Prof. of English & Director, @UMD_MITH. President, Keats-Shelley Assoc.; Past Chair, @ADHOrg; & Co-Founder, @DHcenterNet
attribution.name: Neil Fraistat

quote.text: I work with social media methods and the impact of the ephemerality of social media data on research. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: A1 Hello #docnowcommunity helping Dutch students collect and make publicly available tweets on their uprising against univ board

attribution.bio: Digital archivist & medievalist, tweets on digital archiving, community archiving & making use of archives for historical research
attribution.name: Mirjam Schaap

quote.text: @mjschaap Are you concerned about the University using this tweet collection for negative purposes? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: design for social good. helping build archives with/for/of the marginalized. ux at @UCRLibraries and @documentnow project. la based | nyc | dc transplant
attribution.name: Alexandra DM

quote.text: @fromADMwithlove no, but others might be and they are my concern, so it's more ethical #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Digital archivist & medievalist, tweets on digital archiving, community archiving & making use of archives for historical research
attribution.name: Mirjam Schaap

quote.text: @fromADMwithlove 2nd concern: copyright: is it lawful to harvest tweets from others and publish them on our website? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Digital archivist & medievalist, tweets on digital archiving, community archiving & making use of archives for historical research
attribution.name: Mirjam Schaap

link.author: Mirjam Schaap
link.description: @fromADMwithlove 2nd concern: copyright: is it lawful to harvest tweets from others and publish them on our website? #docnowcommunity
link.title: Mirjam Schaap on Twitter

quote.text: lawful? twitter's ToS seem to say so (with attribution)...though who really knows. ethical? much harder to suss out https://t.co/rUQU6HUKA6

attribution.bio: design for social good. helping build archives with/for/of the marginalized. ux at @UCRLibraries and @documentnow project. la based | nyc | dc transplant
attribution.name: Alexandra DM

quote.text: A1: Started working with social media content on @OurMarathon; particularly interested in archiving / analyzing memes #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoc in Public Digital Humanities @publichumans (Brown University). New media, DH, public history, digital archives, aesthetics, comics, poetry, pop culture
attribution.name: Jim McGrath

quote.text: .@JimMc_Grath interesting, how do you typically identify memes? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu I'm particularly interested in image macros / transformative use of images and text circulating on social media #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoc in Public Digital Humanities @publichumans (Brown University). New media, DH, public history, digital archives, aesthetics, comics, poetry, pop culture
attribution.name: Jim McGrath

quote.text: @edsu but yes, I was recently having a conversation about distinctions between "art" and "memes," so it's hard to define! #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoc in Public Digital Humanities @publichumans (Brown University). New media, DH, public history, digital archives, aesthetics, comics, poetry, pop culture
attribution.name: Jim McGrath

quote.text: @JimMc_Grath @dchud is working on some cool features for DocNow around images. @edsu #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by @jbouie. Tweets by @BergisJules & @edsu

data.text: <hr>
Q2. What are some of the primary challenges you encounter in your research with social media?

quote.text: Q2. What are some of the primary challenges you encounter in your research with social media? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by @jbouie. Tweets by @BergisJules & @edsu
attribution.name: DocumentingTheNow

quote.text: @documentnow Restrictions in API (rate limits) #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: @documentnow One of the greatest challenge involve the ethics and rights of using the social media archives we create. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Prof. of English & Director, @UMD_MITH. President, Keats-Shelley Assoc.; Past Chair, @ADHOrg; & Co-Founder, @DHcenterNet
attribution.name: Neil Fraistat

quote.text: @documentnow 1.relevance to subject 2.balanced as much as possible (all bias represented).3.context available(conversation) #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: A2: The ethical dimensions of archiving social media content; balancing close reading and distant reading #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoc in Public Digital Humanities @publichumans (Brown University). New media, DH, public history, digital archives, aesthetics, comics, poetry, pop culture
attribution.name: Jim McGrath

quote.text: A2: the black boxes of social media platforms, how to evaluate the completeness of what they offer is challenging #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: A2: for me to ones of scoping (what to collect? what hashtags? is that enough?), as well as ethics & preservation Qs. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Assistant professor, @waterloohistory. Marshall McLuhan Centenary Fellow at @ischool_TO. Digital history, data mining, textual analysis. Co-editor, @proghist.
attribution.name: Ian Milligan

quote.text: @ianmilligan1 yes! knowing what to collect and how it was collected is an area that we are focused on in DocNow #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: A.2 Understanding limits of Twitterâ€™s terms of service is complicated in itself, no less how to share the data with others. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Prof. of English & Director, @UMD_MITH. President, Keats-Shelley Assoc.; Past Chair, @ADHOrg; & Co-Founder, @DHcenterNet
attribution.name: Neil Fraistat

quote.text: A2:To scrape or not to scrape?sometimes getting stuff is easier by scraping-but scraping isn't stable/general/shareable #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: .@acnwala that's really interesting -- what about scraping data isn't stable & shareable as compared to data from APIs? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu stability: if DOM changes, code might break if code relies on what changed (DOM usually changes slowly). #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: @edsu stability: e.g if class attr changes, or there's a new one #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: @edsu not-shareable:since Twitter doesn't want to be scraped (terms of serv), I am reluctant to share any code that scrapes #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: @edsu So I only scrape privately #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: @edsu especially when it's about collecting threaded conversations, scraping is straight forward, api - not #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: .@acnwala yes, i've had the same issue myself #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu @acnwala also, scraping software is more easily broken since it usually depends on structures in the page. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: .@walkeroh @acnwala indeed, scraping is the epitome of transient software! more incentives for apis to be stable #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @acnwala @edsu something I worry about with archival datasets too: stability #docnowcommunity esp v/v how to handle deleted tweets

attribution.bio: digital libraries and archives
attribution.name: Brian Dietz

image.caption: A2: what i call the "tweet titanic problem" - "the tweetanic problem" #docnowcommunity https://t.co/rN4PEi1FDX

quote.text: A2: what i call the "tweet titanic problem" - "the tweetanic problem" #docnowcommunity https://t.co/rN4PEi1FDX

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: .@documentnow for me, a big challenge is understanding what sources users draw on to develop beliefs abt how platforms work #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: @edsu issues of publicness, transparency, and concept are difficult at this point in time. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: .@walkeroh how do notions of publicness impact your work? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu I struggle with the idea that public posts are open for use. What does consenting 20k+ accounts look like? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: @edsu while there are guidelines, itâ€™s unclear how to apply these guidelines to social media platforms. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: A2: Not having access to tools / data that social scientists have #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoc in Public Digital Humanities @publichumans (Brown University). New media, DH, public history, digital archives, aesthetics, comics, poetry, pop culture
attribution.name: Jim McGrath

quote.text: .@JimMc_Grath what kinds of barriers are there for getting & using those tools? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: due to server needs? costs? #docnowcommunity https://t.co/1ZkvpoB1zC

attribution.bio: design for social good. helping build archives with/for/of the marginalized. ux at @UCRLibraries and @documentnow project. la based | nyc | dc transplant
attribution.name: Alexandra DM

quote.text: @fromADMwithlove for sure! Also access to skills / resources to be able to get lots of social media data #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoc in Public Digital Humanities @publichumans (Brown University). New media, DH, public history, digital archives, aesthetics, comics, poetry, pop culture
attribution.name: Jim McGrath

quote.text: @edsu money, labor, time, digital space: was thinking of the access to, say, Twitter firehose vs. getting data other ways #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoc in Public Digital Humanities @publichumans (Brown University). New media, DH, public history, digital archives, aesthetics, comics, poetry, pop culture
attribution.name: Jim McGrath

data.text: <hr>
Q3. Do you seek IRB approval (or an equivalent) as part of your research? Why or why not?

quote.text: Q3. Do you seek IRB approval (or an equivalent) as part of your research. Why or why not? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by @jbouie. Tweets by @BergisJules & @edsu
attribution.name: DocumentingTheNow

quote.text: A3. I got IRB approval for the Doc Ferguson study (https://t.co/Tr9xBiUt5L) b/c we did an in-person usability study #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Information scientist, cyclist, soap maker. Associate University Librarian @WUSTLLibraries. Founding Technical Director @BioDivLibrary.
attribution.name: Chris Freeland

quote.text: A3: UMD IRB recently told @SociologistRay @BlackFeministMB & I that consent was not required for public tweets #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @chrisfreeland we were told we weren't doing research! which was kind of a blessing & a curse :-) #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: .@documentnow Most of my work involves intervention, so it's an absolute yes. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: @moduloone how do you assess the potential harms of an intervention in these spaces? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: @walkeroh Very carefully :) Really tho, its not just me assessing. I talk to others to get opinions, IRBs, colleagues, etc. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: @moduloone Great answer! These platforms present new harms, etc. So how do we expand our conceptions of harm? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: .@walkeroh We have individualistic notion of harm based on the empirical Community harm & harm to agency nd 2be considered. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: .@walkeroh @moduloone I'm interested in that question too. it seems harder than usual, but maybe because i haven't done it? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: A3: but when publishing tweets of activists it seems that care is needed like @freelon @meredithclark have in their work #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu @SociologistRay @BlackFeministMB y'all have probably seen this https://t.co/iEGipRApIs about IRBs and alternatives

attribution.bio: digital libraries and archives
attribution.name: Brian Dietz

quote.text: A3. We havenâ€™t, but increasingly thinking thatâ€™s going to be the way things need to move. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Assistant professor, @waterloohistory. Marshall McLuhan Centenary Fellow at @ischool_TO. Digital history, data mining, textual analysis. Co-editor, @proghist.
attribution.name: Ian Milligan

quote.text: @ianmilligan1 Why do you belive that you will need to consider IRB aproval? Can you expand your thinking? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Don't waste time watching other people live the life you want.
attribution.name: Desiree P. Jones

quote.text: @dpjones1983 I guess Iâ€™m becoming uneasy with the (at least for us) consent issues inherent in social media research #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Assistant professor, @waterloohistory. Marshall McLuhan Centenary Fellow at @ischool_TO. Digital history, data mining, textual analysis. Co-editor, @proghist.
attribution.name: Ian Milligan

quote.text: @dpjones1983 i.e. for us historians, we go through IRB for oral history but not public accessible tweets. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Assistant professor, @waterloohistory. Marshall McLuhan Centenary Fellow at @ischool_TO. Digital history, data mining, textual analysis. Co-editor, @proghist.
attribution.name: Ian Milligan

quote.text: A3: during the occupation of Amsterdam uni there were people who 'did not want to be seen', suppose/hope they didn't tweet? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Digital archivist & medievalist, tweets on digital archiving, community archiving & making use of archives for historical research
attribution.name: Mirjam Schaap

quote.text: .@mjschaap did you work with social media data from the occupation? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu indeed, the students estimate we will have to collect ca 6000 tweets from the time of the 5wk occupation #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Digital archivist & medievalist, tweets on digital archiving, community archiving & making use of archives for historical research
attribution.name: Mirjam Schaap

Q4. What tools are you currently using as part of your social media research?

quote.text: Q4. What tools are you currently using as part of your social media research? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by @jbouie. Tweets by @BergisJules & @edsu
attribution.name: DocumentingTheNow

quote.text: @walkeroh What tools have you been using? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Prof. of English & Director, @UMD_MITH. President, Keats-Shelley Assoc.; Past Chair, @ADHOrg; & Co-Founder, @DHcenterNet
attribution.name: Neil Fraistat

quote.text: @fraistat Mostly I use tools Iâ€™ve developed for Twitter data collection. I use heritrix for web archiving. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: @fraistat preservation of metadata is important to my work. Most tools truncate posts post/profile metadata. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: @walkeroh Are the tools youâ€™ve developed shareable with others? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Prof. of English & Director, @UMD_MITH. President, Keats-Shelley Assoc.; Past Chair, @ADHOrg; & Co-Founder, @DHcenterNet
attribution.name: Neil Fraistat

quote.text: @fraistat not yet, but thatâ€™s something Iâ€™m working on. Iâ€™m happy to share privately until theyâ€™re more polished. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: @walkeroh Excellent. We might follow up with you about this. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Prof. of English & Director, @UMD_MITH. President, Keats-Shelley Assoc.; Past Chair, @ADHOrg; & Co-Founder, @DHcenterNet
attribution.name: Neil Fraistat

quote.text: A4. and a combination of Dataverse, Zenodo (Invenio), GitHub, & #Islandora for sharing & providing access to our datasets. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Assistant professor, @waterloohistory. Marshall McLuhan Centenary Fellow at @ischool_TO. Digital history, data mining, textual analysis. Co-editor, @proghist.
attribution.name: Ian Milligan

quote.text: A4: Often I have to make my own tools--TSM https://t.co/jbp8D6S128, fb_scrape https://t.co/m5eOs4cwe4 & other custom stuff #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Associate prof of communication @AmericanU/@AU_SOC. Politics, academia, race/ism, Python when possible, R when necessary.
attribution.name: Deen Freelon

quote.text: .@walkeroh how important is it for researchers to build tools themselves, so they understand how they work? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu itâ€™s important to not conflate ability to build tools and understanding the epistemologies/methods under the hood. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: @edsu most tools arenâ€™t well documented except by the code, so how do potential users evaluate â€” especially researchers? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: .@walkeroh yes, that's what i'm asking; if researchers reach for their own tools because they will understand their limits #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu In light of that, what questions can we ask of the data while respecting its limitations? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: @edsu If tool building isnâ€™t the focus of your research then itâ€™s taking time away from it, right? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: .@walkeroh seems like step one is being able to talk about the limitations -- which is why I'm a big fan of your work. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: A question I've been thinking about is how we can use metadata to support ethics in opendata sets. #docnowcommunity https://t.co/LKfQJmrjFX

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: Like, how do we create provenance to support ethics as part of metadata standards? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: @edsu Creating more researchers focused on these limitations would be a good step. but where should the output go? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

data.text: <hr>
Q5. How important is it for you to publish/share your research data? If yes, how do you do it?

quote.text: Q5. How important is it for you to publish/share your research data? If yes, how do you do it? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by @jbouie. Tweets by @BergisJules & @edsu
attribution.name: DocumentingTheNow

quote.text: A5: I put the Ferguson dataset we worked with up on Internet Archive, but only as a dataset of Tweets IDd (per ToS) #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: A5: please do for you're far ahead in the US, bit pioneering here so I need all the inspiration i can get from you!!! #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Digital archivist & medievalist, tweets on digital archiving, community archiving & making use of archives for historical research
attribution.name: Mirjam Schaap

quote.text: A5. Very important to share research data! Our team has hosted through Dataverse, i.e. https://t.co/WAeqt1oaOy. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Assistant professor, @waterloohistory. Marshall McLuhan Centenary Fellow at @ischool_TO. Digital history, data mining, textual analysis. Co-editor, @proghist.
attribution.name: Ian Milligan

quote.text: A5: very important for scholarly work for reproducibility. Sharing tweet IDs for large dataset #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: .@acnwala Big issue for consent! Many users don't know abt the dozens of metadata fields that may be pulled up #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: A5: I've published Twitter IDs in the past per its TOS. Ppl still ask me for the full datasets! #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Associate prof of communication @AmericanU/@AU_SOC. Politics, academia, race/ism, Python when possible, R when necessary.
attribution.name: Deen Freelon

quote.text:
A5 ^^ I guess that answers that question too. #docnowcommunity
#elxn42 https://t.co/iLslgx73FW
#panamapapers https://t.co/f5TqXCPohd

http://zortonandthecannibals.bandcamp.com/

quote.text: .@dfreelon thanks for doing that! it has been very useful to the @documentnow project #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: A5: But Twitter datasets degrade quickly. Our BLM dataset suffered a 10% attrition rate only a year later. What to do? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Associate prof of communication @AmericanU/@AU_SOC. Politics, academia, race/ism, Python when possible, R when necessary.
attribution.name: Deen Freelon

quote.text: .@dfreelon yes, I still get some too for our Ferguson dataset; do any of them end up hydrating the IDs? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: @edsu Yes, I know of at least one case where someone published a paper based on rehydrating Twitter IDs I originally collected.

attribution.bio: Associate prof of communication @AmericanU/@AU_SOC. Politics, academia, race/ism, Python when possible, R when necessary.
attribution.name: Deen Freelon

quote.text: @dfreelon same with the Egyptian revolution: https://t.co/veFeqp0fvZ (@hanysalaheldeen ) #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: @acnwala I know, I did some of the earliest published work on Arab Spring tweets. @hanysalaheldeen

attribution.bio: Associate prof of communication @AmericanU/@AU_SOC. Politics, academia, race/ism, Python when possible, R when necessary.
attribution.name: Deen Freelon

quote.text: @dfreelon Do you think it would be useful for those folks to have a simple tool to recreate the tweets from the IDs? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by @jbouie. Tweets by @BergisJules & @edsu
attribution.name: DocumentingTheNow

quote.text: @documentnow that would be nice, but 1. still need code to handle large data volumes and 2. attrition still a big problem

attribution.bio: Associate prof of communication @AmericanU/@AU_SOC. Politics, academia, race/ism, Python when possible, R when necessary.
attribution.name: Deen Freelon

quote.text: A5: Sharing data is very important. We share it within our lab. Share IDs for those outside our lab. Not ideal at all! #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: .@walkeroh do you keep any record of the data's provenance when you are doing that sharing? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: I'm a software developer at @umd_mith & study archives on & of the web at @iSchoolUMD
attribution.name: Ed Summers

quote.text: A5 Challenge is finding the best way to model & share these datasets, along w/the best documentation & metadata around them #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: tools + community for documenting the now / banner image: Haaaaands Up! Dooooon't Shoot! by @jbouie. Tweets by @BergisJules & @edsu
attribution.name: DocumentingTheNow

quote.text: .@acnwala Here's an awful question: If what Twitter is is constantly changing, is reproducability actually possible? #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: .@moduloone very difficult to impossible:Twitter's tools seem to favor the now, archives may be crucial for reproducibility #docnowcommunity

attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: @moduloone @acnwala this is an issue for research in general, right? Social media data put a very special spin on it. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: PhD Student in Information Science at the University of Washington. Researching social media methodology, collection, curation, archiving, and analysis.
attribution.name: Shawn Walker

quote.text: @walkeroh @moduloone absolutely, research papers - esoteric, code links broken, datasets - god sent #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Computer Science Ph.D student (Old Dominion University. Member @WebSciDL. @harvardlil fellow. Developer @icanhazmemento, @_wdill. Maintainer Carbon Date. Artist
attribution.name: Alexander C. Nwala

quote.text: @moduloone @acnwala if we archive the data and are willing to share it eventually, we can create a dataset and make it stable

attribution.bio: digital libraries and archives
attribution.name: Brian Dietz

quote.text: .@diuhtez What if 10% of tweets later deleted by users? You can ignore, put this pits reproducability vs respecting users. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

quote.text: .@diuhtez Good point! Does seems to be about the scale of time we need reproducibility in. #docnowcommunity

attribution.bio: Postdoctoral Scholar at the EViD lab @ UMD. Works on technological discourse, users, socio-technical systems, and information flow.
attribution.name: Nicholas Proferes

data.text: Adding links to any website - You can also embed a link to any website, like the official site for a company or event, a Wikipedia page to give background on a subject, or anything else that might give your readers more information. Click the Google source to search for the right site. If you know the direct URL of something you want to embed, use the Embed URL source (the icon looks like a link) and enter it there.

Notify -
Because your stories are social, you can also let the people who are quoted know that they are now part of your story. This is a great way to help your story spread further, as people who are quoted are likely to also share it with their friends. After your story is published, you will be prompted to use the Notify feature. Give it a try - we think you'll love the reaction you get!
Feedback, questions? - Got questions, problems or thoughts about Storify? Please tell us! Send us a tweet to @storify, post to our Facebook page or email support@storify.com.
Enjoy, and thanks for using Storify!
